description.p: All your life you have found Necromancers, Hags, Fiendish Warlocks and all other practitioners of evil magic abhorrent. You seek to root out and slay these monstrosities wherever they may hide. Witch hunters all have different reasons for taking up their profession. Were you hired by a king or other noble to protect their city from an evil deity or cult? Or maybe you are a cleric or paladin dedicated to seeking out all those who endorse the abomination of arcane magic? Think about what led you to develop such a hatred. Perhaps your younger sister was abducted by a hag, and replaced with a changeling that you were then forced to kill, or your mother and father were sacrificed then raised again by a wicked mage. What are your methods? Do you imprison those you capture in pits? Burn them? Or even drag them back to your lordly master for a public execution?

Skill Proficiencies:Any two of: Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Survival
Tool Proficiencies:Alchemist's tools, One type of gaming set
Languages:You can choose two of the exotic languages
Equipment:Alchemist tools, a set of dark traveler's clothes including a cape with a hood or puritan hat, a book that contains all Fey, Fiend or Undead creatures and their descriptions and weaknesses, a crowbar, holy water, and a pouch of 20 gp

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I travel from place to place a lot - evil must be fought everywhere.
I constantly guide my allies away from the Dark Ways - I would hate to have to kill them.
I barely ever sleep or rest, so intent am I upon seeking out evil.
My wise words have often convinced another to step back into the light.
I do not work for money - rich and poor alike can succumb to the temptations of Black Magic.
I look carefully over everything I see - the Dark is cunning, and but one lapse could doom the world.
I prefer to hunt my foes alone - there are many pitfalls for those less skilled than me to fall foul of.
I am suspicious of everyone, especially those who dislike me.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Redemption. If my foe wishes to repent, I am willing to help them return to the light. (Good)
Freedom. I do not knuckle under authority - that would only slow me down. (Chaotic)
Law. The law is all that keeps evil at bay. (Lawful)
Skill. I fight the darkness to prove I can, and I constantly challenge myself to get better at it. (Neutral)
Mercilessness. once you have turned to the dark, there is no turning back - not in my eyes. (Neutral)
Pain. I take a perverse pleasure in inflicting pain on my captives. (Evil)

select.name: Bond
select.item: Civilization is a beacon in the night that must remain burning.
I once showed mercy to a young warlock, whom I fell deeply in love with. I still wonder if I did the right thing.
My family and friends are always there to fall back on when all seems lost, to rekindle the light in me.
My only bond is to the silver in my sword.
Pursuing this dangerous path has forced me to leave behind those I love, if only to protect them.
My only kin are those of my Witch Hunting brotherhood.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: Once I start killing, I cannot stop.
I am overly aggressive/prejudiced toward all magic wielders, excluding myself.
I will pursue a target no matter the cost.
My lust for revenge/avarice spurs me to be brash and reckless.
I will kill any monster, good or evil.
I will risk the lives of innocents to catch my target.

description.p: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to identify necromancy, fiendish or fey magic, or a practitioner of any of these techniques (this includes identifiying a Fey, Fiend or Undead, even if they do not directly practice that type of magic). Also you can roll on intelligence checks to recall information about them.
